data.title: Cursors don't work correctly over bridges.
Add plumbing for mod-defined sound loaders
data.body:
Use cases are #10032 and moving `AudLoader` and `WavLoader` out of the engine and into Common.
This brings sound loaders on par with sprite loaders and their `ISpriteLoader` and enables every mod to define it's own loaders.

Note: this is for sound effects/voices only. Music is still [hardcoded](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/GameRules/MusicInfo.cs#L43-L48). Fixing that both is out of scope here and will conflict with the unglobaling of the file system.

data.title: Fixed crashes when NatDevice.GetExternalIP() fails
data.body:
Rule of thumb when working with Mono.NAT: try/catch everything.

Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9405.
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9671.

Compare https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/2993.

It isn't obvious, but somehow even simply getting an external IP address can cause MappingExceptions?!

data.title: Added an in-game client tooltip with IP and country
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3564.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/11323125/4d301612-910a-11e5-9ef0-7726ac54ca42.png)

This does not add latency on purpose. See the discussion at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6752.

data.title: Fixed highest density sprite frame never being rendered
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9795. In fact this changes the whole rendering. Not sure if my math is correct, but we now see the last gem frame and I believe single ore patches are also rendered in a thin manner.

data.title: Fixed crashes when saving maps in folders without write access.
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9430. To test add something invalid to `MapFolders:` in your `mod.yaml` file.

Our current CancelPrompt didn't really scale well with error messages longer than a few hard-coded words. I gave my best to fix text box overflow issues, but I am not really an expert with those chrome.yaml definitions and I guess this will be the major focus of the reviewers. Suggestions for improvement are very welcome.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/11322663/863d0a00-90f6-11e5-8284-bf35351ebb6f.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/11322669/a6b37238-90f6-11e5-8a6d-4e75385fcbf2.png)

data.title: Fix width of the MP filter checkboxes.
data.body: Fixes #10034.

data.title: Prevent invalid cells checks in SeedsResource
data.body: Fixes the seeding crash from #10039. Untested, but matches with the stack trace.

data.title: Fix a NRE when destroying SAM Sites in GDI06.
data.body:
Fixes a regression from #9414.
`facing` is null for turreted structures, and in any case body facing != turret facing.

data.title: Add IsDead checks to gdi06
data.body:
Fixes a crash reported by @Snurre86 on IRC:

```
Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> Eluant.LuaException: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'e4 (dead)' does not define a property 'Patrol'
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.Call(IList`1 args)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.Call(LuaFunction fn, IList`1 args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.UtilsGlobal.Do(LuaValue[] collection, LuaFunction func)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.UnsafeInvokeInternal(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Object[] arguments)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptMemberWrapper.Invoke(LuaVararg args)
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.UnsafeInvokeInternal(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Object[] arguments)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.MethodWrapper.Invoke(Object[] parms)
   at Eluant.LuaRuntime.MakeManagedCall(IntPtr state, MethodWrapper wrapper)
   at OpenRA.Scripting.ScriptContext.FatalError(String message)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Scripting.ScriptTriggers.Killed(Actor self, AttackInfo e)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Health.InflictDamage(Actor self, Actor attacker, Int32 damage, IWarhead warhead, Boolean ignoreModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Actor.InflictDamage(Actor attacker, Int32 damage, IWarhead warhead)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads.DamageWarhead.DoImpact(Actor victim, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads.SpreadDamageWarhead.DoImpact(WPos pos, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Warheads.DamageWarhead.DoImpact(Target target, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.<Impact>c__AnonStorey2.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.GameRules.WeaponInfo.Impact(Target target, Actor firedBy, IEnumerable`1 damageModifiers)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Bullet.Explode(World world)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.Bullet.Tick(World world)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__4(IEffect e)
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

It happens when you kill the flame throwers before killing the rifle man patroling at the entrance.

data.title: Tiberium Sun: Selling tech should still allow you to build the advanced units
data.body:
In the original game selling off a radar or advanced tech center would still allow all existing production buildings to make use of the tech. eg. building an advanced tech center and selling it straight away would still allow the creation of banshees from an existing helipad.
If the last production building of that type was destroyed the tech would then be reset.
Also if sold the tech center before building the helipad you wouldn't be able to build banshees.
Think this would be great to implement into the Tiberium Sun mod

data.title: Teammate can build when enemy engineer are converting base
data.body:
When a base are being converted by engineer, the initial owner of base can't build, but his teammates yes.

data.body:
Purpose of Phase Tank: To sneak past base defenses
What it cant do: Sneak past base defenses

data.title: Add Faction to Voiced
data.body:
Allows setting of a specific faction voice when a unit is shared across factions.

Precursor to fixing #10049

data.title: Dr Dmitri doesn't have a Russian accent
data.body:
In the mission 'Monster Tank Madness', you have to rescue a Soviet defector. 

Currently he uses the generic male civilian voice which I feel sounds out of place. Stavros' voiceset doesn't sound right here either.

data.title: Add CHAN to EmitInfantryOnSell on certain structures.
data.body:
Currently when selling buildings there is a certain randomness involved in what infantry are returned. Selling a msilo could net you an engineer and a rifle or it could net you two unarmed civilians.

Due to the RNG, selling these high-tech structures in MP doesn't really have any influence on a match. These structures are rarely sold for any reason other than imminent destruction.

This PR adds the possibility to receive the scientist when selling certain high-tech structures. It is purely an 'easter egg' polish linking multi-player to single-player. This should have no effect in single-player missions.

Depends on #10045

data.title: Add the briefing video to atreides03a
data.body: Fixes #10033.

data.title: Red Alert AA-guns fire outside their range circle
data.body:
That's the case with any actor to some extent. They are able to fire at targets that are on cells that are only barely inside their range, having the actual target position just outside the range circle.
This, however, I believe is different. Targeting (and range circle rendering) is done based on cells, without any regard for altitude. Here are two screenshots:
First one is of an AA gun firing at a Mig (it was firing at the moment the screenshot was taken because of GPS):
![](http://i.imgur.com/BZTGl2U.png)

And the second one shows two AA guns _not_ targeting the Mig that is supposedly inside their range:
![](http://i.imgur.com/Je38ooh.png)

This undoubtedly affects all anti-air defenses in all mods.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28480770-red-alert-aa-guns-fire-outside-their-range-circle?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Rename Chan to Scientist.
data.body:
These infantry are used as scientists in ra missions.

I kept the 'CHAN' easter egg reference to C&C TD.

data.title: GDI05 vs GDI03 airstrike inconsistency
data.body: GDI03 gives you a full powered 3-plane strike, while GDI05 only gives you a puny single plane.  This doesn't really make sense.

data.title: GDI05: harvesters idle after transferring ownership to the player
data.body: If you run a unit into the destroyed base _while the harvester is en route to unload_ (doesn't happen if it is actively harvesting) it will park in front of the refinery and remain idle.

data.title: Unload passengers / cargo on death
data.body:
Bit hacky approach, works by nudging passengers on exit so they don't bunch up.

The changes in EnterTransport will cancel any of the passengers activity, since mobile will discard nudges if not idle.

Kills any cargo it can't unload (when in water etc)

Edit:
No changes in EnterTransport, added a check in Enter to move on to the next activity and don't wait for the next tick. Also use Mobile.Nudge instead of INotifyBlockingMove.OnNotifyBlockingMove

http://gfycat.com/ImpishImaginativeFlea

https://gfycat.com/BoilingLimpAfricanjacana
